data.text:
2024

January 15, 2024 - In celebration of Martin Luther King Day, Grammy winner Gloria Gaynor of "I Will Survive" fame released a video collaboration with the Harrison Sheckler Virtual Choir, performing her song, "Talkin' 'Bout Jesus." The video premiered on the Fox News flaship show Fox & Friends and YouTube. I was honored to be part of the Sheckler Virtual Choir, backing this amazing artist on a cool song.

2023

Septemer 30, 2023 - I was interviewed by Ashley Frasca, host of Green and Growing, on Atlanta's historic WSB Radio. We discussed daffodils, the Georgia Daffodil Society and the forthcoming 2024 American Daffodil Society Southeast Regional Show.

July 8, 2023 - In a nationally distributed ABC News article, "Americans beliefs about politicization of Supreme Court differ widely based on political affiliation," writers Caroline Curran and Laura Gersony published my remarks on the topic as an independent voter.

April 18, 2023 - I was a guest speaker at the Garden Club of Georgia Convention at the Atlanta Evergreen Lakeside Resort in Stone Mountain where I presented "Georgia on My Mind: Twelve Essential Daffodils for Georgia Gardens" before a large, enthusiastic audience.

2022

August 10, 2022 - The Gospel Music Association in Nashville revealed the nominations for Dove Awards, and the Collingsworth Family's project, Just Sing! (2021), on which my song "I Owe You Everything" appears, was among the nominees for Southern Gospel Album of the Year.

March 18, 2022 - At the East Tennessee Daffodil Society Show in Knoxville, I won two American Daffodil Society Awards: the Lavender Ribbon (for best five miniature stems) and the White Ribbon (for best three stems).

March 12, 2022 - At the Georgia Daffodil Society Show at the Chattahoochee Nature Center in Roswell, Georgia (suburban Atlanta), I took several major American Daffodil Society Awards, including the Purple Ribbon (for best five stem collection in show), Rose Ribbon (for best standard seedling in the show) and the Marie Bozievich Ribbon (for best collection of twelve stems from four different daffodil divisions).

February 25, 2022 - At the Atlanta Botanical Garden Flower Show, I won multiple blue ribbons with succulents and daffodils, and my own homebred daffodil seedling GSF-10A-17-01 ('Katrina Rea' x Koopowitz seedling HK2-08) won the prestigious Propagation Award.

2021

November 19, 2021 - The Grammy-nominated gospel group, the Collingsworth Family, released its project, Just Sing!, a Gaither Music CD/DVD that contains "I Owe You Everything." The song was co-written by Babbie Mason and myself. Just Sing! debuted at number one on the iTunes Christian charts.

October 2021 - The Spalding Garden Club in Dunwoody, Georgia (suburban Atlanta) heartily welcomed me as a guest speaker, and my talk, "Georgia on My Mind: Twelve Essential Daffodils for Georgia Gardens," was very well-received. Everyone also left with bulbs from my garden.

August 9, 2021 - I was quoted extensively in Kelly Burch's article "How to reupholster a chair and breathe new life into old furniture," which appeared at Insider.com (Business Insider). The article has subsequently appeared on Business Insider's websites in Australia, The Netherlands and elsewhere.

April 17, 2021 - The Tyler Gallagher interview, originally appearing in Authority Magazine, was syndicated and subsequently published by Arianna Huffington's Thrive Global as "Greg Freeman of 'Greg Freeman Media': 'Remember and Self-reflect'."

March 10, 2021 - My interview with Tyler Gallagher for Authority Magazine was published. Part of a series of interviews with prominent business leaders and public figures, the article was titled "Putting The United Back Into the United States: Greg Freeman of 'Greg Freeman Media' On The 5 Things That Each Of Us Can Do To Help Unite Our Polarized Society."

January 2021 - Authentic was awarded the prestigious Eclipse Awards for American Champion Three-Year-Old Male and American Horse of the Year.

2020

November 9, 2020 - Following his victory in the Breeders' Cup Classic, Authentic was retired to stud at Spendthrift Farm, located less than half an hour from Keeneland Race Course in Lexington, Kentucky, where he had experienced his final career win.

November 7, 2020 - In the Breeders' Cup Classic, Authentic's final career race, he handily won, beating his nearest contender, Improbable, by 2 1/4 lengths and setting a new track record.

October 3, 2020 - Like the Kentucky Derby, the Preakness Stakes had been postponed to a much later date. The prestigious classic, held at Baltimore's Pimlico Race Course, was a memorable one, with Authentic and the outstanding filly, Swiss Skydiver, running head to head, leaving the rest of the field some ten lengths behind. In the end, Swiss Skydiver beat Authentic by a neck in the second fastest Preakness ever. The time of 1:53.28 had been beaten only by Triple Crown winner Secretariat in 1973.

September 5, 2020 - Due to COVID-19, the Kentucky Derby had been delayed to September instead of being held on the first Saturday in May. Following his less than stellar performance in the Haskell, Authentic and caused some to doubt his stamina, and jockey Mike E. Smith, who had ridden him to victory in the Haskell, chose to mount Honor A.P. instead. John R. Velasquez took the reins and steered Authentic to victory in the 146th running of the Derby, beating the nearest challenger, Tiz the Law, in an exciting finish by 1 1/4 lengths, claiming the seventh fastest Derby in history.

September 2020 - Music around the World: A Global Encyclopedia (edited by Drs. Andrew R. Martin and Matthew Mihalka) was published by Goleta, California, USA-based ABC CLIO. The exhaustive three-volume resource included my entries on Mahalia Jackson and W. C. Handy.

July 18, 2020 - Having been shipped from California to Monmouth Park in New Jersey to compete in the Grade I Haskell Invitational, Authentic led the field in the 1 1/8 mile race with Hall of Fame jockey Mike E. Smith aboard. Still immature and easily distracted, Authentic lost interest in the race near the finish, beating second place winner NY Traffic by a nose.

June 2020 - After evaluating numerous buying opportunities, I opted to buy shares in the Thoroughbred racehorse Authentic through the MyRaceHorse Stable. Trained by Hall of Fame trainer Bob Baffert, the colt by Into Mischief and out of the Mr. Greeley mare, Flawless, appeared to be the most promising offering I had seen in a long time.

April 18, 2020 - Guy Penrod's nationally televised show, Gospel Music Showcase (Daystar TV), featured The Chitans. Among their performances on this episode was a rousing rendition of "So Good to Know," which I wrote with Babbie Mason.

February 4, 2020 - I addressed the Spartanburg Garden Club Council at the Chapman Cultural Center in downtown Spartanburg, South Carolina. My presentation, "A Century of Daffodil Hybridizing: Using Advancements in Color, Form and Size to Advantage," was well-received.

January 27, 2020 - Sarah Lyon's article, "A Brief History of the Art Déco Design Movement," written for nationally-known ApartmentTherapy.com, included a quote from me and a mention of ComfortandFlair.com, one of the latest publications in my Greg Freeman Publishing portfolio.

2019

June 17, 2019 - I addressed the Spartanburg Men's Garden Club with a presentation titled "Seven Plants No Upstate South Carolina Garden Should Be Without." This talk was well-received, and it is exciting to learn of all the great things this organization is doing in the Spartanburg, South Carolina community.

June 15, 2019 - My comments were included in Bree Liddell's article, "Where to Get the Best Philly Cheesesteak at the Philadelphia Airport," at TravelAwaits.com.

April 6, 2019 - For the first time, I exhibited daffodils at the Kentucky Daffodil and Bulb Society Show near Lexington. I had several class winners, including 'Perpetuation' which won the Helen Trueblood Ribbon for Best Single Stem in the show.

April 1, 2019 - An episode of Babbie Mason's television talkshow, Babbie's House, featuring me as a guest, aired in the Atlanta area today. The show also airs nationally on the National Religious Broadcasters (NRB) network. Babbie and I sang a duet on her great song, "The House That Love Built," and I performed two songs from my project, Blessing and Blessing, including Bill Gaither's "If It Keeps Gettin' Better" and mine and Babbie's song, "Nothing Can Separate Me."

March 16, 2019 - My daffodils fared well once again, this time at the East Tennessee Daffodil Society Show in Knoxville. Four of the five contenders for Best in Show were my entries. 'Stoke Charity', a flower from my Marie Bozievich Ribbon-winning collection won the Gold Ribbon (Best in Show). 'Jeanie Driver from the same collection won Best Intermediate (neither a miniature nor a standard). One of my seedlings won the Rose Ribbon. And one or two other entries won their classes.

March 9, 2019 - At the Georgia Daffodil Society Show in Roswell, my daffodil entries did very well. I won major American Daffodil Society awards, including the Rose Ribbon (for best seedling or homebred entry), White Ribbon (best three standard stems), Lavender Ribbon (given to best collection of five miniatures) and the Marie Bozievich Ribbon (awarded to the best collection of twelve daffodils from at least four divisions such as trumpets, doubles, jonquils, etc.). My seedling was a strong contender for Best in Show, but was beaten by a stunning specimen of 'Hot Gossip' exhibited by the late John Lipscomb's daughter, Dr. Susan Goodman.

January 22, 2019 - I was the featured artist on Atlanta Live, the flagship program at WATC TV 57. Hosting the show were Dr. Erol and Sandra Onal!

January 16, 2019 - Babbie Mason interviewed me and featured "Nothing Can Separate Me (from Your Love)" in an episode of Babbie's House on the Radio on BabbieMasonRadio.com. The song, included on my project, Blessing and Blessing, was co-written with Babbie earlier in 2018.

2018

December 28, 2018 - My gospel music EP, Blessing and Blessing, released. It contains five songs, including one featuring Grammy-nominated Babbie Mason and another one featuring Gospel Music Hall of Fame inductee Calvin Newton.

December 16, 2018 - Toronto-based gospel group The Chitans released an album, So Good to Know, the title song of which I wrote with Babbie Mason.

October 15, 2018 - The Chitans performed "So Good to Know" at the National Quartet Convention in Sevierville, Tennessee. The title cut of their new recording project, the song was written by Babbie Mason and myself. It was so exciting to see video of the group singing this song. It was a real crowd pleasing performance!

June 2018 - Goleta, California-based publisher ABC CLIO Greenwood released the two-volume compendium, The British Emprie: A Historical Encyclopedia (Dr. Mark Doyle, editor), which contains one entry by me regarding the British Music Hall.

May/June 2018 - The American Gardener magazine, published by the American Horticultural Society, included my piece on the native honeysuckle selection, Lonicera sempervirens 'Blanche Sandman', in its "Plant in the Spotlight" column.

March 24, 2018 - At the East Tennessee Daffodil Society Show in Maryville, Tennessee, I exhibited 13 entries, taking nine firsts and four seconds. My winners included a first place vase of three with 'Stoke Charity', as well as single stem firsts with 'Beryl' (pre-1907), 'Intrigue', 'Forged Gold' and a Delia Bankhead tazetta seedling (which was a contender for Best Miniature in Show). I also exhibited the Best Seedling with my homebred jonquil, a cross between Narcissus jonquilla and 'Bright Sequins'.

March 19, 2018 - I was a guest speaker at the March meeting of the Gwinnett County Master Gardeners Association. My presentation, "A Century of Daffodil Hybridizing: Using Advancements in Color, Form and Size to Advantage," was well-received by the suburban Atlanta gardeners in attendance.

March 10, 2018 - The American Daffodil Society Southeast Regional Show was hosted by the Georgia Daffodil Society at the Chattahoochee Nature Center in Roswell. For this event, I exhibited and judged, winning several blue ribbons, and taking ADS ribbons for Best Intermediate with 'Jeanie Driver" and the Bozievich Collection, my first such win, which must contain twelve standard daffodil cultivars/species from at least four Royal Horticultural Society divisions (i.e. - Trumpet, Jonquil, Double).

2017

July 7, 2017 - Race in American Film: Voices and Visions That Shaped a Nation (Dr. Daniel Bernardi & Michael Green, eds.) was published by ABC CLIO Greenwood. The three-volume encyclopedia includes my entries on St. Louis Blues, Giant, Driving Miss Daisy, The Color Purple, Elia Kazan and Tyler Perry.

2016

November 16, 2016 - Once again in 2016, I was a guest on Babbie Mason's talkshow, Babbie's House. In my interview, we discussed gospel music history and black gospel's influence upon my music. I performed "Sunlight and Shadows" and "God Be With You."

April 11, 2016 - In a nationally distributed news story about presidential politics, my comments were featured in an Associated Press article by Julie Pace and Emily Swanson, titled "AP-GfK Poll: On range of issues, Clinton has edge over Trump."

March 26, 2016 - At the American Daffodil Society Southeast Regional Show hosted by the East Tennessee Daffodil Society in Knoxville, I had a winning vase of three 'Hot Gossip', a first place vase of three DuBose jonquil seedlings, a first place vase of three 'Actaea' and first place single stems with 'Hot Gossip', 'Sammy Girl', 'Mesa Verde' and my home-bred seedling, GSF-05A-11-01 (a contender for Best in Show and the ADS Rose Ribbon for Best Seedling).

March 12, 2016 - My exhibits at the Georgia Daffodil Society Show near Atlanta fared pretty well. I had the first place Down Under Collection (consisting of 'Wild Women', 'Terminator', 'Coobar', 'Erlicheer' and 'Splatter'). My single stem entry of 'Wild Women', a wonderful trumpet daffodil from Tasmania, was a contender for Best in Show. My vase of three 'Hot Gossip' was also a blue ribbon winner.

March 2, 2016 - I was a guest on Babbie Mason's talkshow, Babbie's House. Babbie and I paid tribute to the life and music of Andrae Crouch, gathering at the piano sharing stories and singing great Andrae songs such as "Soon and Very Soon," "The Blood Will Never Lose Its Power," "My Tribute" and "Let the Church Say Amen." Babbie's House is viewed nationally on the NRB network for DirecTV viewers as locally in the Atlanta area on WATC TV 57.

2015

December 17, 2015 - I was a guest on the 1 1/2-hour long variety show Atlanta Live at Atlanta's WATC TV 57. Hosted by Betty Cornett and Pastor Mark Haston, the show included a brief interview with me and four musical performances. I sang "You Are," "Jesus, What A Wonderful Child," "I Call Him Lord" and "Change a Life."

October 27, 2015 - Gender and the Modern Sherlock Holmes: Essays on Film and Television Adaptations Since 2009 (Jefferson, North Carolina: McFarland and Company, Inc., Publishers, 2015), edited by Nadine Farghaly, was published. I contributed a chapter titled, "The Evolution of Sherlock Holmes: An Examination of a Timeless Figure Amid Changing Times."

October 5, 2015 - H.O.P.E. Ministries of the Upstate had me come perform for a special graduation banquet at First Baptist Spartanburg. I sang my own songs, "Between the Lines" and "Holy Spirit, Will You Speak to Me?" as well as "One Day."

September 14, 2015 - I appeared on Nite Line, a two-hour variety show at WGGS TV 16 (Greenville). My song selections were "There Is Power in the Blood," "Between the Lines" and "One Day."

August 12, 2015 - Babbie Mason and I finished writing an exciting new song, "I Owe You Everything."

June 29, 2015 - Grakan Tert published my Harper Lee article on its website. The piece was translated into Armenian by my friend, Elfik Zohrabyan.

June 19, 2015 - My article, "American Novelist Set to Release Sequel to Pulitzer Prize Winner More Than Half Century Later," was published in Grakan Tert, the weekly literary newspaper of the Yerevan-based Writers' Union of Armenia. Elfik Zohrabyan, a prominent Armenian playwright, author and actor, translated the piece into Armenian and was responsible for getting the article published.

April 10, 2015 - At the American Daffodil Society National Convention and Show in Williamsburg, Virginia, I had several first place winners, including 'Dena', a delightful pink-rimmed cultivar from Brian Duncan in Northern Ireland. This daffodil was incorporated into my hybridizing program in 2015 and should prove to be an exciting parent.

March 21, 2015 - On the same day as the Nasvhille show (for which I had entered flowers the evening before), I student judged and exhibited at the East Tennessee Daffodil Society Show, held in the Ellington Plant Sciences Building on the campus of the University of Tennessee in Knoxville. My winning 'Hot Gossip' single stem was awarded the Frank Galyon Award for the best yellow-red daffodil in the show. I also took a blue ribbon with a single stem of 'Intrigue'. However, I was most thrilled to win the standard seedling class with my own daffodil, GSF-06A-14-01 ('Stoke Charity' x 'Cool Shades'), which was awarded the coveted Rose Ribbon.

March 28, 2015 - I received verification that, having completed all necessary requirements set forth by the American Daffodil Society, I am now an accredited judge.

March 21, 2015 - From a handful of entries, I took blue ribbons, including an important award, at the Middle Tennessee Daffodil Society Show in Nashville. My vase of three 'Hot Gossip' won first place and was awarded the American Daffodil Society's White Ribbon for the best vase of three standard daffodils in the show. A vase of three 'Stoke Charity' earned me a blue ribbon, and I also had a winning collection of five large-cupped daffodils containing 'Hot Gossip', 'Florence Joy', 'Pimento', 'Cool Shades' and 'Sapnis'.

March 20, 2015 - At Nashville's Cheekwood Botanical Garden and Museum of Art, I completed my final daffodil judging school, the American Daffodil Society's Judge's School III, hosted by the Middle Tennessee Daffodil Society. I will soon be certified as an ADS judge.

March 14, 2015 - My four entries at the American Daffodil Society Southeast Regional Show (Georgia Daffodil Society) near Atlanta all took first place ribbons. My entries were a vase of three 'Hot Gossip', a vase of three 'Tanagra', a single stem 'Terminator' and a collection of five miniature cultivars or species, which included 'Mite', 'Little Beauty', Narcissus jonquilla subsp. henrequesii, 'Tête-à-Tête' and 'Tanagra'.
